website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy mountain bike tire that won't break the bank.
pros: Very sturdy with good traction on sand and hard-packed dirt
cons: Better as a rear tire than a front tire

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. I am 220 lbs and take my bike through pretty hard terrain, do a little bit of jumping on the hills as well and these tires never made me feel unsafe. Unless you are a professional, which you probably wouldn't be reading these review, these tires will do just fine for mount/trail biking, no need to spend more. Again unless you are a professional, it is not the tires what is going to limit you, but YOU.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 50-50 Chance on this one
customer_reviews.text: First, the zip ties usually on Maxxis tire products were not there. I passed this by as maybe a mistake, but when I began to put the tire on my rim, I noticed that is was very dirty. I also noticed that the Maxxis logo had began to wear off. There was dirt in the tired nubs which indicated that this tired might be used... I want a refund or for them to send me a new tire. The tire is in okay condition, but I was expecting a new tire, so I was quite disheartened to find it in this condition.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Love These Tires
customer_reviews.text: They do come folded which makes the slightly challenging to install but not overly difficult if you have experience changing bicycle tires. They grip amazing on the loose sand of northwestern lower Michigan, I use them on front and rear on a trek with 26" wheels. I have tried a few others but keep coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Shred it up with this tire
customer_reviews.text: This tire shreds the trails like navy seals dragging bin laden’s face over a cheese grater Would recommend for back tire or front, loves the mud and has great sidewalk toughness like Rambo in Vietnam
customer_reviews.author: El Conquestidor

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: Decent tires. They had great grip when I first started using them. I only use them in trails and after about 50 miles I can already notice a huge difference. They don't grip like they used to. Treading is much lower and it is visually noticable. However, not bad for the price and I would recommend them for light use on trails.
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: Good for loose sand and dirt
customer_reviews.text: My stock front tires were 1.95, skinny, and didn't grip well in loose dirt or sand. I was sliding out and damn near killing myself. I put 2.1's on figuring the width and the better then stock tread would be helpful. It did! I grip better in my turns, even then sharp downhill turns. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice on Road, Good on Dirt
customer_reviews.text: Run really nicely on roads for knobby tires. They are good for when I have to ride quite a few miles on the road before reaching the trails. Good compromise. Wish they were a bit wider.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Great rear tire, poor front tire.
customer_reviews.text: these are a very narrow tire. I use one currently in the rear, and a kenda nevegal in the front. The treads are VERY knobby, so it's great for climbing hills where you need to dig in. However, I would not recommend this tire for a FRONT tire on a 29er unless you're looking for straight line speed. it can definitely get dicey around the corners, and a bit skiddish when maneuvering your bike at high speeds around rocky single track.
customer_reviews.author: Wil Ketchin

customer_reviews.title: good tire for the price
customer_reviews.text: hooks up on trail great and time will tell longevity.
customer_reviews.author: goldeng

customer_reviews.title: Great Traction
customer_reviews.text: Good grip! Traction is out of this world. Lost a bit of speed because these are a lot knobbier than my previous tires, but they grab and stick on a pretty varied terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Wright

customer_reviews.title: Mud, snow, dry-pack and anything in between = No Problem
customer_reviews.text: The tires work well under pretty much any condition I threw at them. I ride pavement to get to off road, summer, winter, spring and fall. They handled surprising well in mud, snow , dry pack and anything in between. These will be my go to tires for my 29'er.
customer_reviews.author: C. Engel

customer_reviews.title: 2.35 x 26 60a not 70a
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2.35x26 70a tire for use on the front of my bike. What arrived was the 60a version. I wanted this tire for higher air volume to reduce pinch flats, and wider for better cornering and more cushion. this tire has provided all of these. I have put about 50 single track miles on it so far and there is no visible wear even after going across multiple sharp edged rocks. I would recommend this tire for loose over hard pack, and rocky areas. while it does not have a high roll resistance, it is not a great tire if you use your bike on streets. The soft compound tends to degrade quickly on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: christian prout

customer_reviews.title: Great tires
customer_reviews.text: After seeing these on pretty much every bike in my climb, I finally laid out the extra dough and bought these. We ride the same route each week, and I'm been amazed and really happy to find traction and riding over obstacles (logs, rocks & roots) that I would usually slip or wheel free-spin with the old tires.
customer_reviews.author: CalDrummer

customer_reviews.title: Good grip and fast
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a replacement for my Kendal small block 8. The kendas failed when used with sealant. So far, these ignitors are doing great. The bead was loose on my cobalt rims, so I have to run a strip of gorilla tape around the wheel to get it to hold air. Since these are not ust rated, i didn't see this as a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: mayjalook

customer_reviews.title: Nice tread
customer_reviews.text: Good tires. Using them on my 04 Stumpjumper. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Lemus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tread
customer_reviews.text: These tires exceeded my expectations. They provide significant traction on sandy trails, glide through mud, and grip rocky terrain. The best upgrade to a mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best all-round tires I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best all-round tires I have ever used! Great bite in the corners and offers great traction while climbing even in muddy conditions. Have 300 miles on these from asphalt to dirt to rocks and wear is typical not excessive.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty_Biker

customer_reviews.title: great tires
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed and great price. Awesome bike tires holding up well no sign of wear for riding in the streets of ny or when I go off road. I bought two of these one for the front one for the back. They are holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Solid tire but with some disapointment.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 70a 26x2.35 and 70a 26x2.1 and when I received it both tires was 60a. When I mounted the tires on my rim I noticed a significant difference in size even through my previous Bontrager XR2 (26x2.1) and XR4 EXP (26x2.35) tires was much larger than my new Ignitor tires. Nevertheless I put those tire to use and noticed significant grip improvement over my older tires. Wished I went with 26x2.35 both sides or possibly even larger tire.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire that wont slide out from you
customer_reviews.text: These bike tires Rock! Excellent traction for street riding. Im not a dirt rider, so hitting the pavement is my thing and these tires suite me just fine. Also, they look Awesome! heavy BOLD lettering stands out very nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lara

customer_reviews.title: but first impressions are very good.
customer_reviews.text: FYI.. as someone else mentioned... I ordered the 70a version and got the 60 instead. I don't really care.. tire is exactly what I was looking for. I don't have many miles on it yet, but first impressions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tire! Good price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tire! It bites anything, no slipping even on 35% to 40% inclines. Rolls smooth and fast, although not the fastest tire I've had (Panaracer 2.1s XCT tire). Very pleased with this tire, will be coming back for more. Would have paid $20.00 more at a bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: M. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great grip on the trail
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert by any means. I however did notice a huge difference from the stock tires that came with the bike. Great grip on the trail. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Swadley

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire -
customer_reviews.text: It was everything that I expected. Great tire I had 1300 mile on my last set and the back tire was getting a bald so it was time for an update. Very happy with the tread pattern it rides smooth while providing a great grip.
customer_reviews.author: SierraRandy

customer_reviews.title: Good for my 29er
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good.....I use these tires with my new tubes and haven't had a problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Love them! Def ordering a second set!
customer_reviews.text: I ride a lot of single track with roots and large rocks, it's often semi wet with a loose debris. I love this tire, it's a fast roller yet grabs when you need it, I will def be ordering a second set!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl K.

customer_reviews.title: great but run small
customer_reviews.text: I love these on the rear. Climbing up rock gardens and steep inclines they bite great. Cornering is great. I got the 2.1 and they are easily 1.9s. Next time I'll get 2.2s so I get 2.1s in reality.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good longevity and ground control
customer_reviews.text: My go-to tires for years of running tubeless. Pretty good longevity and ground control.
customer_reviews.author: Nick in AZTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great XC tire
customer_reviews.text: I ride nothing but cross country and these tires have been great on my single speed. They seem to do really well in cornering compared to my Hutchison Pythons. I am getting another one for my geared bike up front, and I am considering a Kenda small block for the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very good mtb tires, meant for trails only
customer_reviews.text: Best MTB tires I've ever owned. Great traction on many surfaces. Not cheap and fair amount of rolling noise.
customer_reviews.author: mcp70

customer_reviews.title: Great front tire.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a front tire. Look amazing, hope they wear amazing too.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: keep coming back
customer_reviews.text: These came as OEM on my mountain bike back in 2005. I've been through a bunch of others, but I keep coming back to these; I'm probably on my tenth. It's mostly dry hard-packed single-track around here (CA central coast), with some medium-loose stuff. I'm definitely more of an uphill/xc rider than an aggro downhill guy, so I'm looking for reasonable traction and long life, not crazy cornering downhill. (hard-tail 26" bike)
customer_reviews.author: John B. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Wobble and poor Maxxis customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The tread is not evenly applied, very visible wobble when riding. Filed a claim with Maxxis for replacement and they requested more pictures - I sent more and no reply even sent a follow up email - so their product is deffective and their customer service sucks. I really liked how the tire performed but I don't want to pay more money and risk getting anouther defective tire.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S. Sato

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Arizona Desert
customer_reviews.text: This tire grabs the pee gravel and sandy environment very well. It seems to be holding up well to the sharp jagged rocks. I would recommend it for the dry climates. I can't vouch for the wet ones
customer_reviews.author: C. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Not Tubeless As Commented
customer_reviews.text: This tire is not labeled or claimed to be tubeless from Maxxis, period, that is true. However, multiple customer reviews state that it can be converted into a tubeless tire with the correct equipment. I have used everything, even a powerful shot of high pressure air to expand it, no go. I have a lot of tubeless experience. They cannot be converted to tubeless. Also, they are not 2.1 inches wide just like most of their other tires. If you want a Maxxis 2.1, order a 2.35 or more in order to get something close to a 2.1. Never got to use them, but they do look like a really great tire. Will return these and exchange for UST 2.35
customer_reviews.author: Patrick JF

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis ignitor mtb folding tire 70a, 29x2.1
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bike with these tires on it. I have owned mtbs for 25 years and have had a variety of knobby tires. I like this tire a lot. It stays cleaner than other styles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tire!!!!! A little on the heavier side, but these tires hook up like a boss!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Parshall

customer_reviews.title: Good for Price
customer_reviews.text: Good for loose stuff. Too soft for pavement... Had problems with back end kicking out.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cole

customer_reviews.title: awesome tire; great traction
customer_reviews.text: awesome tire; great traction; I placed this at the front; does not have a super high rolling resistance; I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.author: David P. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Sticky and Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Great tires, excellent grip and traction and can still maintain good speed. Very satisfied with purchase. Would reccomend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hillbug

customer_reviews.title: great grip
customer_reviews.text: Great grip, long lasting, good traction in the dirt. Not enough mud here in the desert to test it in mud. Front tire. 2.1 on rear.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Gold

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tire, will be buying another for my other wheel soon!
customer_reviews.author: FortuneHunter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tire
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for the discontinued tire I got with my Novara (REI) mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Tire
customer_reviews.text: Worked it was a gift good price and is enjoyed every day. Would recommend it to others and it was shipped as promised.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickF

customer_reviews.title: Best tire
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that I bought maxxis tires for my mountain bike. Tires are well built and handles great. Easy to install. I love to mountain bike tough and muddy. These tires can handle my tough biking
customer_reviews.author: Tcat

customer_reviews.title: Ignite the night
customer_reviews.text: Great tread pattern and composition. Holds through loose, sandy, washy turns and doesn't break free. Low rolling resistance yet it has tons of traction. This is ideal for trail riding and single track riding.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great XC tire
customer_reviews.text: I run these tires on the front and rear of my bike (30PSI front and 32 PSI in the rear). I use them mainly on hard-pack singletrack, light gravel trails and some tarmac. The rear tire lasted me about a year and a half and I still have about half the tread on the front tire. I ride often, around 600-700 miles during this time-frame. The tires hookup well when climbing and hold in tight turns. Just bought a couple more for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Crahen

customer_reviews.title: I installed it in the rear and it works excellent for me
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in the rear and it works excellent for me. I use it in loose and hard loose, sometimes a little combination with road
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Maxxis, great ride!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Maxxis Ignitor tires. They provide traction and comfort on the ride. Would purchase them again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony James

customer_reviews.title: F#%ken great tire!
customer_reviews.text: I use this tire On my 26" hardtail in the rear on different terrain. F#%ken great tire! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: david verduzco

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Than Expected.
customer_reviews.text: While I'm not a mountain bike world expert, I do ride very often and aware of my bike's components. Long story short, I wanted to try this tire after using Kenda Nevegal (26x2.35) for three years because of the positive reviews here. Unfortunately, the tire of same size (26x2.35) is considerably smaller than the Kenda one. Now, I guess tires depend on one's designated bike usage, but I would not use this tire for any attempt of fast descending. Kenda, in my perspective, provides much better support for moderate DH, jumps, roots, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amit A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Tires I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tires I have ever owned. Perfect sized knobs for mud dirt leaves loose gravel anything, the only thing they do not ride well on is the paved street. They are lighter than my last tires too and hardly lose any air, have used for one season so far in the rocky trails of NH and they stood up great. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Tires! I ride nearly everyday through a dry ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Tires! I ride nearly everyday through a dry river bed combined with street riding and these tires provide an excellent ride on both surfaces and with dual disk brakes stopping in loose dirt and rocks has not been a problem for these tires so far. Definitely a Good Buy!!
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: This tire was worth every penny. This season has ...
customer_reviews.text: This tire was worth every penny. This season has been wet as can be and this tire powered through it all. I will continue to buy this exact tire every time I need one until they quit making them.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Reed

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tire
customer_reviews.text: They work in everything but heavy mud. The will not throw it and you end up with a slick tire. They are good for hard pack, soft pack, rock and sand. I recommend the 70a because they last a little longer. The down side on the 70a is their not as sticky so the traction is not as good. All around great tire. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grab extremely well on the dirt trails in Houston along buffalo bayou.
customer_reviews.author: brook gehle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome  Tire
customer_reviews.text: I could tell a difference with this tire over my old ones within the first min. I bought and installed this tire on the front and rear at the same time, there is a noticable differnce in the corners. I hit a couple of the corners I am use to and I was able to lay the bike into the curve alot more than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Niceun

customer_reviews.title: light but delicate
customer_reviews.text: ehh ran as tubeless. fast rolling and light as a rear tire. had spins on granny gear on steep climbs but gripped well otherwise. but that lightness means a really thin sidewall. lasted around 300 miles before i got a sidewall tear just short of the bead seal. no way did i puncture it as the tear site sat inside the rim. rim is smooth without any burrs or sharp edges/damage. i had a hard time finding it on the trail. pulled off the tire and sure enough a 3mm tear that was irreparable with patch or plug. delicate and would not use again unless desperate.
customer_reviews.author: omaha

customer_reviews.title: Tear it up
customer_reviews.text: Love these tires. I use them on a single track. The SART trail in southern California is a tough trail but these tires tear it up.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 70A and they shipped me 60A. Also, the tires are not wider than my previous 26x2.1. If anything, they just have bigger tread. Not too happy with the tire size. Soft rubber, feels like itll be easy to get a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rundlett

customer_reviews.title: good all around tire
customer_reviews.text: Running tubeless for 1 1/2 seasons as a front tire on Stans Flows. Pressure is 22 psi vs. my 190 lbs. Hooks up great. I can point the tire almost anywhere on the trail and it follows. Great traction vs durability. Aired up well. Down side is that the side walls are on the thin side.
customer_reviews.author: scwman

customer_reviews.title: Great traction on and off road
customer_reviews.text: Everything they claim they were. Great traction on and off road. Great roll.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Weber

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding XC tire
customer_reviews.text: I've just started riding the Maxxis Ignitors, so my experience is limited. They seem to be great tires for my area, DC, MD, & VA. I have used Continental Escape, Specialized Roll X, and Hutchinson Bulldogs most recently. I got the Ignitors because of their more rounded shoulder knobs. They give you a better feel through turns and don't break loose like tires with square shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bruck

customer_reviews.title: ... then that I have absolutely no complaints they are awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Getting them on was a little difficult as they come folded but other then that I have absolutely no complaints they are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Best Cross Country tires
customer_reviews.text: I've not ridden tires like these in a very long time. I used to race cross country and always was looking for tire that would grip like these do. I enjoy going fast down hill and after trying the tires after installing I was pleasantly surprised with how good they perform. Low rolling resistant, great on tight and open turns regardless the loose, hard pack or rocky terrain. I totally recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Chinazo

customer_reviews.title: Great Mtn bike tire
customer_reviews.text: Top quality Mtn bike tire for all terrain. Hold up great with Stans tubeless.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good all around time. I'm using it as a front tire.
customer_reviews.author: david harvison

customer_reviews.title: Just put them on and love the feel and look of the tires
customer_reviews.text: Just put them on and love the feel and look of the tires. Haven't hit the trails yet but plan on it as soon as the weather cooperates.
customer_reviews.author: michael a consentino

customer_reviews.title: Nice tires, but only a little road use on ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice tires, but only a little road use on it as a rear tire and the tread was noticeably worn.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Working out well so far. It's Been raining a lot where I ride, so the trails have been muddy & soggy, and the rocks slippery. All in all though, the tires have done well and I've felt pretty comfortable. Packed on some mud on a few occasions, but the tires shed it fairly well. (Do not hold up as well for heavy mud conditions). Been able to maintain decent speed as well. Overall, nice purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Like em so far
customer_reviews.text: They grip really well. So well that it was throwing dirt up as I rode. Like em so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Anguiano

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far, Only one ride on them but seem to be a very capable tire!
customer_reviews.author: Santi Barroso

customer_reviews.title: In the middle for XC and DH
customer_reviews.text: It is advertised as 70a but arrived 60a compound, which is harder. Others notice the same issue, the dealer is misleading In its advertisement. The tyre is ok, too heavy and fat for XC and not tracky enough and too soft for DH, more like in the middle...
customer_reviews.author: luis v.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service. Am actually about to order another one right now.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good all around
customer_reviews.text: Get tread! I ride all moutian bike trials and pavement! Good all around!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Schelling

customer_reviews.title: very nice tire
customer_reviews.text: These tires hook up awesome in the corners. I will certainly be buying another pair when I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan LaBrecque

customer_reviews.title: Its a tire - needs time to know how well it holds up
customer_reviews.text: I would like to find a steel belted tire - or Kevlar - that holds up better than the bike tires I find available and thicker where the rubber meets the road. I do a mix of paved and dirt road biking and this looks adequate. My rear tire always wears out first. In my new location I hope to hit more dirt roads than paved.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Solid, esp the R
customer_reviews.text: Previously ran Nevegals in 2.3 width. These were a lot lighter. The rear tracks well even in loose limestone, typical of Central Texas trails. The front wants to push in loose dirt, but that makes things kind of fun :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product, quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great product, quick delivery. Initially it does not fit well to my rims, but after couple of races were fitted good!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Adolfo

customer_reviews.title: Good grip, good tire, can be mounted tubeless
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this tire on my rear MTB wheel. I use the Stans No Tube kit. No issue (see my review for Stans No Tube). Good grip on wet terrain. Side walls resist abrasion very well so far, no pinch fat, no puncture. Rode also on lose over hard packed trail with sharp rocks and here again, very good handling and grip. Comfortable to ride, roll well.
customer_reviews.author: Yannick

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Round and black
customer_reviews.text: Oh, you. What you do you do like its never been done. Except that one time. We should be friends
customer_reviews.author: Hepsiebaw Mchorselstrapp

customer_reviews.title: ... a built up wheel and so far it works great, lots of traction and very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Put on the back wheel of my home made trike on a built up wheel and so far it works great, lots of traction and very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: wm

product_meta.title: Maxxis Ignitor Mountain Bike Tire
product_meta.description: The Ignitor tread pattern was designed for the most discerning professional racers and already has laid claim to multiple World Cup victories. The well-spaced tread pattern fills in nicely to provide low rolling resistance in the straights, while the ramped pentagonal knobs provide excellent traction in the corners and in medium soil.
feature_bullets: Used by professionals and amateurs alike
Designed to roll fast and hook up in medium to loose conditions
Long lasting 70a or race-proven eXCeption Series 62a compounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
